Description: Lower body sherd of large Corinthian black-figured pottery alabastron; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of goat grazing to left (neck with added red, part of beard, forelegs and part of underbelly with red remaining); dots and incised blobs as filling ornament; below, three black bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 38, pl. XVIII, no. 50)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.279) (phase 3)
